comments.author: kawetsriyanto
comments.body: OP, do you ask this suggestion for your local board or for global board?If it is for your local board, I think it is no need for a specific board since you can discuss it on your main board. The main board can cover general issues/matters which aren't related to the child boards. For local boards, I think we don't need too many child boards, it is unnecessary. We have limited members on local boards. We can discuss it in global boards which are related to the topics, we already have some child boards about games in the marketplace board.- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=71.0- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=207.0

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Theymos rarely new boards, except when he adds them for new languages when there's enough demand.  As for child boards and anything dealing with non-bitcoin subjects, I suspect he's not eager to add any more than already exist.  I can't say I know much about blockchain games or what their future prospects are, but even if they were scorching hot right now, it'd still be way too early to add a subsection.  Same thing with NFTs.  Can you imagine if Theymos had added an ICO child board back in 2018?  ICOs were a popular fad, but that's all they turned out to be, and it took quite a bit of time to determine that.  In hindsight, currently irrational people might come to realize that there's nothing special or collectible about digital art that just happens to be linked to a blockchain.  See my point?There have been many, many proposals for new sections over the years and I'm not sure if I've ever seen one acted on by Theymos.  That's what you're up against, OP.

comments.body: You can use Criptomoedas Alternativas section to discuss blockchain games in your language. I see almost no activity there, so having a dedicated subsection for only a small part of altcoins is not necessary.For the global part, there are various threads about blockchain games in Altcoin Discussion, Service Announcements (Altcoins) and Service Discussion (Altcoins). Unless they are so numerous that they overshadow other topics, don't expect a dedicated board for "blockchain games".

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: This is a forum about Bitcoin in the first place, so all attention is directed towards Bitcoin and things related to it, while the rest of Altcoin is all secondary to the forum.We already have a wide choice of sections in the forum, so I don't think the forum admins are too interested in adding new sections.In addition (my own opinion) Blockchain games have a lot of scam and adding them here may cause unintended harm to some users.
